text: <https://twitter.com/simonmcs/status/1375425624148434944|https://twitter.com/simonmcs/status/1375425624148434944> does someone want to try Octavian there? :sweat_smile:

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/simonmcs|@simonmcs>: Some tremendous results came from the 3rd Isambard Hackathon this week, including the BLIS team achieving over 2.5 TFLOP/s on one A64fx, or ~92% of peak for our 1.8GHz nodes, impressive! <https://pbs.twimg.com/media/ExZ-QfdXEAA_lqp.png>
attachments.text: Some tremendous results came from the 3rd Isambard Hackathon this week, including the BLIS team achieving over 2.5 TFLOP/s on one A64fx, or ~92% of peak for our 1.8GHz nodes, impressive! <https://pbs.twimg.com/media/ExZ-QfdXEAA_lqp.png>

elements.text: does someone want to try Octavian there?

text: I know it was partly in jest, but Simon might be up for it!

elements.text: I know it was partly in jest, but Simon might be up for it!

text: That'd be great! <@UAUPJLBQX> mentioned on zulip that initially he needs to do only some exploratory work, like collecting the features detected by llvm and some other information about the CPU

elements.text: mentioned on zulip that initially he needs to do only some exploratory work, like collecting the features detected by llvm and some other information about the CPU

text: I'm happy to provide an introduction if you don't know him personally - he's in my school and I've worked with him on a few (admin) things. I've previously mentioned Julia to him but he didn't know that much about it.

elements.text: I'm happy to provide an introduction if you don't know him personally - he's in my school and I've worked with him on a few (admin) things. I've previously mentioned Julia to him but he didn't know that much about it.

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/simonmcs|@simonmcs>: We're porting BabelStream to Rust and Julia, to go along with the OpenMP 4.5, SYCL, OpenCL, Kokkos, Raja, CUDA and OpenACC versions. Are any of my Twitter followers Rust experts? If so, would you review our code before we release it? <https://github.com/UoB-HPC/BabelStream>
attachments.text: We're porting BabelStream to Rust and Julia, to go along with the OpenMP 4.5, SYCL, OpenCL, Kokkos, Raja, CUDA and OpenACC versions. Are any of my Twitter followers Rust experts? If so, would you review our code before we release it? <https://github.com/UoB-HPC/BabelStream>

elements.text: I'm happy to provide an introduction if you don't know him personally - he's in my school and I've worked with him on a few (admin) things.
I've previously mentioned Julia to him but he didn't know that much about it.
Well, apparently he knows it a bit more now:

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/TheNextPlatform|@TheNextPlatform>: After toiling away in relative obscurity for over a decade, open source Julia is right on time for the big enterprise AI/ML code modernization party <https://www.nextplatform.com/2021/03/22/why-julia-is-turning-heads-in-2021/>
attachments.text: After toiling away in relative obscurity for over a decade, open source Julia is right on time for the big enterprise AI/ML code modernization party <https://www.nextplatform.com/2021/03/22/why-julia-is-turning-heads-in-2021/>

text: Great! I haven't chatted to him much in the last year (the coffee room has been strangely empty for a while :thinking_face:). I've pinged him on Twitter - hopefully he bites!

elements.text: Great! I haven't chatted to him much in the last year (the coffee room has been strangely empty for a while
). I've pinged him on Twitter - hopefully he bites!

text: The A64FX seems like a really cool CPU, so it'd be cool to play with/optimize.

elements.text: The A64FX seems like a really cool CPU, so it'd be cool to play with/optimize.
